result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianna C. Walsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE requests expunction.  DE may renew her request in writing upon successful completion of probation.  Court may schedule a hearing and grant if satisfied.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. May not have contact with any Woodman's, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna C. Walsh

records.addlTxt: 11:20 AM Defendant Brianna C. Walsh in court.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Brianna C. Walsh.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  DE enters guilty plea. Court finds DE guilty. PSI waived. State is compliant with victim rights notification.  No claims for restitution.  Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.    DE requests expunction.  DE may renew her request in writing upon successful completion of probation.  Court may schedule hearing and grant if satisfied.  Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

ADDRESS INFO for Brianna C. Walsh
Current: 6101 5th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143   (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 811 45th St, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States

Defendant, Brianna C. Walsh, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
